title: 2003년 Jeremy Armstrong v. Daniel Bertrand, Warden 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Jeremy Armstrong v. Daniel Bertrand, Warden. 판결일: 2003-07-17. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Jeremy ARMSTRONG, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Daniel BERTRAND, Warden, Respondent-Appellee
**판결일**: 2003-07-17
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Cudahy, Kanne, Manion

## 변호인

Robin Shellow, Angela C. Kachelski (argued), The Shellow Group, Milwaukee, WI, for Petitioner-Appellant., William L. Gansner (argued), Office of Attorney General, Wisconsin Dept, of Justice, Madison, WI, for Respondent-Appel-lee.

## 인용

- 336 F.3d 620

## 판결문 요약

336 F.3d 620
    Jeremy ARMSTRONG, Petitioner-Appellant,v.Daniel BERTRAND, Warden, Respondent-Appellee.
    No. 02-3379.
    United States Court of Appeals, Seventh Circuit.
    Argued April 3, 2003.
    Decided July 17, 2003.
    
      COPYRIGHT MATERIAL OMITTED Robin Shellow, Angela C. Kachelski (argued), The Shellow Group, Milwaukee, WI, for Petitioner-Appellant.
      William L. Gansner (argued), Office of the Attorney General, Wisconsin Dept. of Justice, Madison, WI, for Respondent-Appellee.
      Before CUDAHY, MANION and KANNE, Circuit Judges.
      CUDAHY, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      Six years ago, fifteen year-old Jeremy Armstrong shot and killed Robert Drury, his father's roommate. A Wisconsin state jury found Armstrong guilty of first-degree reckless homicide and he was sentenced as an adult to a prison term not to exceed 20 years. A Wisconsin Court of Appeals affirmed the conviction, and Armstrong's petition for review to the Wisconsin Supreme Court was denied. Armstrong appeals now from the Eastern District of Wisconsin's denial of habeas relief. We affirm.
    
    I.
    
      2
      At age fifteen, Jeremy Armstrong was a high school student with more than his share of challenges. His time was divided between his separated parents—his mother Cheryl, who was mentally ill, and his father Robert, who was a crack addict. His father's roommate, Robert Drury, was also a crack addict and repeatedly threatened Armstrong with both physical and sexual...
